channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7698] race between RS shutdown thread and openregionhandler causes region to get stuck
item.description:
2013-01-22 17:59:03,237 INFO [Shutdown of org.apache.hadoop.hbase.fs.HFileSystem@5984cf08] hbase.MiniHBaseCluster$SingleFileSystemShutdownThread(186): Hook closing fs=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.fs.HFileSystem@5984cf08
...
2013-01-22 17:59:03,411 DEBUG [RS_OPEN_REGION-10.11.2.92,50661,1358906192942-0] regionserver.HRegion(1001): Closing IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServersTargeted,66666660,1358906196709.0200b366bc37c5afd1185f7d487c7dfb.: disabling compactions & flushes
2013-01-22 17:59:03,411 DEBUG [RS_OPEN_REGION-10.11.2.92,50661,1358906192942-0] regionserver.HRegion(1023): Updates disabled for region IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServersTargeted,66666660,1358906196709.0200b366bc37c5afd1185f7d487c7dfb.
2013-01-22 17:59:03,415 ERROR [RS_OPEN_REGION-10.11.2.92,50661,1358906192942-0] executor.EventHandler(205): Caught throwable while processing event M_RS_OPEN_REGION
java.io.IOException: java.io.IOException: java.io.IOException: Filesystem closed
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.doClose(HRegion.java:1058)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.close(HRegion.java:974)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.close(HRegion.java:945)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.handler.OpenRegionHandler.cleanupFailedOpen(OpenRegionHandler.java:459)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.handler.OpenRegionHandler.process(OpenRegionHandler.java:143)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.executor.EventHandler.run(EventHandler.java:202)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)

tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen or transitionToOpened below is never called and region can get stuck.
As an added benefit, the meta is already written by that time.
item.summary: race between RS shutdown thread and openregionhandler causes region to get stuck

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Well, there's also incorrect handling on master side, but this is trivial to avoid here
I assume this occurs in both 0.94 and trunk?
Let me check this out today.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Were you going to take a look? I thought the patch would be trivial (update state in ZK before FS calls, or catch exceptions; maybe see other calls before for what can be done after ZK update instead/needs exceptions caught) and was planning to make one today. I will unassign myself for now.
Pls assign it to yourself if you are having a patch already. It will take a couple of days for me to come up with a patch anyway.

Here we can set a boolean saying if transition happened to FAILED_OPEN .
If openSuccess == false and the new flag is also false then we can try doing the update to FAILED_OPEN once in finally block.
Any way any ZK exception while doing this FAILED_OPEN update has to be thrown out i feel.
Uploading a patch. Pls check if this ok. Not the final one. Will come up with a testcase too shortly too.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12567729/HBASE-7698.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessControlFilter

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4307//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.

Ram, should we set transitionToFailedOpen to true inside the tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen method?

I have seen some other errors related to Filesystem being closed while shutdown the mini cluster (or some nodes).
Is it possible to make sure Filesystem is not closed before all others are closed/shutdown?

Ram, should we set transitionToFailedOpen to true inside the tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen method?

Any specific reason Jimmy may be am missing what is there in your mind?
The reason for doing it was, the tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen() does not throw any exception out.
So if this method is executed either successfully or failure, we need not retry it in the finally. That was my intention.

Is it possible to make sure Filesystem is not closed before all others are closed/shutdown?

Yes this should be the best soln.
As far as the log attached by Sergey(in HBASE-7701) i did not see what caused the FS to get closed. I thought may be being an integration test case there were steps to even stop NN abruptly.
Thanks for the review Jimmy and sorry for the delay.
Still not done any changes to the fix. But added a testcase that shows the problem.

Any specific reason Jimmy may be am missing what is there in your mind?

I just meant not to set transitionToFailedOpen to true after tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen is called each time,
if we do this inside the tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen method.
Updated patch addressing Jimmy's comments.
Hmm... does this actually set the external variable?
Also, there are some whitespace issues in javadoc and in test file.

Oops.. Basics..
So then the first patch should be fine? Or we need to pass an object to set the variable? What you feel Sergey?
I will update the whitespaces issues too in the next patch.

The testcase also did not reveal the problem as the transition in finally block will silently fail .
Anyway uploading the previous patch here correcting whitespaces.

This message is automatically generated.

I do not know that code well... I'll trust you on this one.
Patch seems fine for 0.94 inclusion.

The code doesn't look efficient to me (an existing issue of course). Not a big deal. I was wondering if we can move calling tryTransitionFromOpeningToFailedOpen(regionInfo) to the final block, so that we don't need the local variable transitionToFailedOpen, and we can cover all scenarios as long as openSuccessful is not true. @Ram, what do you think?

Maybe we move cleanupFailedOpen to the final block as well. Both are for clean up after some issues, which sounds to me better to be in the final block so that it's done all the time if not open successfully.

We can address this in a separate jira if you prefer.
If we move cleanup into finally block we still need to make sure ZK gets updated if possible, if other part of cleanup fails
Yes, that's right.
Should we commit as is and discuss perf improvement in another issue?
It is ok with me.

@Jimmy
Your suggestion makes sense. So will raise an improvement for the same.
Can we commit this then?
Raised HBASE-7790 for the improvement.
@Ram, sure, +1 for commit.

Thanks for the review Sergey, Jimmy and Lars.
Committed to trunk and 0.94.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3861 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3861/)
